intro: Hedysarum volkii, commonly known as Volk's peavine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Ethiopia. It is a perennial vine characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a legume pod that contains several seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. Hedysarum volkii is adapted to arid and rocky environments, showcasing its resilience in harsh conditions.
